description:
See http://pastebin.com/2q2sG1K9 for the stacktrace.

AuthMiddleware in the OpenStack API expects the AuthManager to return dicts as users and tokens, but it returns proper objects.  So when AuthMiddleware tries to access attributes by subscripting, it barfs.
title: OpenStack API auth manager not processing Users/Tokens correctly

comments.content:
See http://pastebin.com/2q2sG1K9 for the stacktrace.

AuthMiddleware in the OpenStack API expects the AuthManager to return dicts as users and tokens, but it returns proper objects.  So when AuthMiddleware tries to access attributes by subscripting, it barfs.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gundlach

comments.content: Works great!  And it revealed another bug that I'm about to report.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mike-mayo
